authors.name: Atif  Khan
authors.affiliation: [Bhabha Atomic Research Centre, Homi Bhabha National Institute, Anushaktinagar, Mumbai, India]

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vhel","text":"Bacteriophages are bacteria-specific viruses having great potential as therapeutic agents against multidrug-resistant strains/bacteria.Though \"phage therapy\" is a century-old concept, there is very limited progress on its therapeutic application due to the rapid expansion in antibiotics portfolios in the last few decades. However, the emergence of multidrug-resistant organisms in the recent past has brought back our attention to bacteriophages. The first step towards developing effective phage therapy against multidrug-resistant bacteria is isolation, amplification, and purification of specific bacteriophages. There are many reported protocols for the isolation of host-specific bacteriophages from the environment. However, most of them are complex, multistep, low-yielding, resource-intensive protocols, requiring elaborate laboratory setup. We have demonstrated a simple two-step, high-yielding protocol for isolating and amplifying bacteriophages against Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). We have shown that mixing various environmental samples (i.e. sample pooling) and phage amplification at two different temperatures significantly enhance the yield of MRSA phages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":989,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Bacteriophage,methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA),Sample pooling,Phage yield,Environmental phages
manuscript_citation: Khan, A., & Joshi, H. (2022). Simple two-step, high yield protocol for isolation and amplification of bacteriophages against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Current Protocols, 2, e395. doi: 10.1002/cpz1.395

steps.section: STEP 1: PREPARATION OF WATER SAMPLE FILTRATE FOR ISOLATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES (CRITICAL STEP)*
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhksl","text":"Collect untreated sewage water samples from the domestic sewage treatment plant and hospital wastewater treatment plant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bd9q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ivf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":155,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":124,"style":"sup"}],"key":"89j2j","text":"One can also use any alternative environmental sample for the isolation of specific phages. Keep the collected samples at 4 0C to avoid sample degradation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 1: PREPARATION OF WATER SAMPLE FILTRATE FOR ISOLATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES (CRITICAL STEP)*
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c21vl","text":"Collect solid fecal samples from cages of chicken poultry farm and store them at 4°C until further processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20evq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1CE9A800080F11EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: STEP 1: PREPARATION OF WATER SAMPLE FILTRATE FOR ISOLATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES (CRITICAL STEP)*
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qgkj","text":"Weigh 10 g of dry poultry farm fecal sample and mix it with 100 mL of sterile saline in a sterile 250 mL conical flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35as4","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ucjf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a40c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfcsa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c79je","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"2C1C6230081011EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"361CF600081011EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":78,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"49kto","text":"Samples should be handled carefully with all microbiological safety protocols.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 1: PREPARATION OF WATER SAMPLE FILTRATE FOR ISOLATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES (CRITICAL STEP)*
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vk04","text":"Keep the suspension at 30 0C for 5 – 6 h at 120 rpm to detach the phages from solid particles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":26,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mec2","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bcgd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"49066C10081011EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"50107C30081011EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"6 hr","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

After use, the centrifuge should be cleaned with suitable surface sterilization methods to prevent contamination.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 1: PREPARATION OF WATER SAMPLE FILTRATE FOR ISOLATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES (CRITICAL STEP)*
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ubec","text":"Mix all three filtrates (Domestic sewage, hospital wastewater, and poultry farm) in a sterile environment to make a single filtrate suspension (pooled sample) for isolation of MRSA-specific bacteriophages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ipev","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dumh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12ng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":113,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":93,"style":"sup"}],"key":"3lpfg","text":"All three samples should be mixed in laminar airflow, and the suspension should be kept at 4 0C for further use. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 2: GROWTH OF BACTERIAL HOST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d4b9h","text":"Thaw the glycerol stock of MRSA stored at -80 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":46,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mh67","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7pmgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":52,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":44,"offset":60,"style":"italic"}],"key":"db5qk","text":"Thawing should be performed by tapping to gradually increase the temperature to avoid sudden heat shock.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 2: GROWTH OF BACTERIAL HOST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2q3hg","text":"Inoculate 5 µL of the thawed culture in 20 mL of TSB in a 50 ml sterile conical flask and incubate for 24 h at 37 0C and 120 rpm.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":114,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7739o","text":"      ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5oefq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"69410B10081111EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"6D39E390081111EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"732D2C80081111EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: STEP 2: GROWTH OF BACTERIAL HOST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"29hfk","text":"The grown culture was centrifuged at 10,000 rpm for 10 min and resuspended the pellet in 10 mL of fresh TSB. Use this suspension for the isolation and enrichment of MRSA-specific bacteriophages.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f28ro","text":"    ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9s9s5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"7AB4F820081111EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"35CF350008DD11EDB212612C1169A067","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"25","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

steps.section: STEP 3: ENRICHMENT/AMPLIFICATION OF MRSA BACTERIOPHAGES
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6vs5g","text":"Mix 10 mL of pooled sample filtrate (obtained Step 1) and 10 mL of sterile 2X TSB in a 50 mL sterile glass conical flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6onte","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bt5td","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmr20","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4n5vb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"B137C130081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":242,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":2,"offset":49,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":59,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":147,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":157,"style":"sub"}],"key":"fevu9","text":"Some literature says the addition of 5 mM of CaCl2 and MgCl2 promotes phage adsorption on the host cell surface. In this case, the addition of CaCl2 and MgCl2 in TSB leads to precipitation of salts and should not be added if working with TSB.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 3: ENRICHMENT/AMPLIFICATION OF MRSA BACTERIOPHAGES
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"23me","text":"Add 1 mL of an overnight grown pure culture of MRSA (obtained from Step-2) to the above suspension and mix gently. Incubate the suspension at 30 0C for 24 h at 85 rpm.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":145,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hu2m","text":"    ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmqeo","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k0h6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e3vtj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"CDBA56B0081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D358EFF0081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":239,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":20,"style":"sup"}],"key":"dikau","text":"A temperature of 30 0C is known to induce maximum adsorption of phages on the host cell surface. A low shaking speed at 85 rpm prevents the desorption of phages from the host cell surface while providing gentle mixing for bacterial growth.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 3: ENRICHMENT/AMPLIFICATION OF MRSA BACTERIOPHAGES
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"frgm0","text":"Following incubation at 30 0C, Incubate the suspension at 4 0C for 24-48 hr.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":27,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":60,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"183om","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"56hee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DDFEC470081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: STEP 3: ENRICHMENT/AMPLIFICATION OF MRSA BACTERIOPHAGES
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"lajr","text":"After 24-48 hr, centrifuge the suspension at 14,000 rpm for 15 min and filter the supernatant through a sterile 0.2 µm syringe filter.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81fp3","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4lg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"14000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E1E4FF50081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"25","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

steps.section: STEP 3: ENRICHMENT/AMPLIFICATION OF MRSA BACTERIOPHAGES
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"at0pm","text":"Quantify the titer of bacteriophages in the filtrate using the drop cast method (as described in step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"592o4","text":"Quantification of bacteriophages in the filtrate obtained in any step of the experiment can be done using the drop cast method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ege0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bfq41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arml0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adu9m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Chhibber S, Kaur P, Gondil VS","can_edit":1,"date":"1543622400","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jviromet.2018.09.001","guid":"487CD770081511EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":1887,"journal":"Journal of virological methods","protocol_id":"0","title":"Simple drop cast method for enumeration of bacteriophages."}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":151,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"541pt","text":"The method is called the drop cast method due to the spotting of drops on the lawn of the bacterial host and counting the plaque developed in the drop.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"acpft","text":"Take 100 µL of overnight grown pure culture of MRSA (from Step-2) and mix with 3 mL of molten soft agar (TSB + 0.6% Agar).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fnm9","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9h1q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"00AA7FF0081611EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"03F405A0081611EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"512c5","text":"Pour the suspension on prepared hard agar (TSB + 2% Agar) and allow it to solidify.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"317s1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fafih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":45,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fop0c","text":"This step should be done in laminar airflow. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3pr9f","text":"To quantify bacteriophages in the given filtrate, serially dilute the filtrate in SM buffer and spot 5 µL of each dilution on the bacterial lawn. Allow the plates to solidify completely.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u4of","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dhg6e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"16BD97A0081611EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5o7ho","text":"Incubate the solidified plates overnight at 37 0C for the development of clear visible plaques. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":47,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vro3","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b52o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1B5C9B30081611EDAD3FA56C1412DED9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: STEP 4: QUANTIFICATION OF BACTERIOPHAGES BY DROP CAST TEST
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj0q9","text":"Calculate the phage titer (PFU/mL) by using the following formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq6u0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ngnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lvm8","text":"Number of PFU/mL=     Number of plaques in a drop X Dilution factor","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":22,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asfv4","text":"                                                              Volume of drop spotted","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
